column2: one of the most interesting art venues in the LA region
column3: The Torrance Art Museum proved to be one of the most interesting art venues in the LA region. Finding intriguing contemporary art in Los Angeles is not easy. Most of the art museums within the LA region focus on blue chip, historical and modernist art. Truly great art gallery and museum exhibitions that focus on the cutting edge are relatively few and far between within this sprawling megacity. The Torrance Art Museum is one of a few in the LA region contemporary in the publicly funded Kunsthalle style. According to the Assistant Curator, Benjamin Tippin, their current emphasis is on art that defines the edge between digital art, sculpture and video. The director and head curator of the Torrance, Max Presneill has been named one of the “8 Best Art Curators In Los Angeles” by CBS Los Angeles . It is well worth a visit.

column2: Superb building for displaying Art - but what of the Art?
column3: A really good Modern Building with excellent display spaces.What you make of the art on display all depends on what is on - and what your own taste in Art is.We saw a comparative display - of Art from both Los Angeles and then from New York.Some of what was exhibited had been well executed and was very artistic. However the majority was "pretty average" to the point of being "pretentious".That was our view - others are more than welcome to disagree!!Free entry, donations always welcome.
